11.content:
"Well, suppose I ought to go visit that psychic. If she's actually legit, maybe she'll be able to, I don't know, 'commune' with me or something - help me figure out what I'm supposed to do now."

You walked, or rather floated back down the street to the hole-in-the-wall shop you'd seen, Esmerelda's Ethereal Emporium. A faux crystal ball sat in the front window, surrounded by purple chiffon curtains above which hung a sign that read, "$20 Palmistry Readings ~ Walk-ins Welcome".

The place looked dodgy already, and you considered leaving right then and there, but something drew you to enter - an energy of sorts, like the static that clings after a rainstorm. You glided straight through the front door, past the deserted reception counter, and into the back room.

There, seated at a table and illuminated by a single candle, was a simple looking woman dressed in scant gypsy robes. Perhaps as you were expecting, she didn't seem to notice as you entered. Hesitantly, you called out in a ghostly voice, "Hello?"
11.title: Visiting A Psychic

The aging woman at the table didn't respond to you in the slightest, but you were able to determine what the source of the energy you'd felt had been. Around her neck as a simple chain holding a glimmering scarlet pendant. It almost seemed to... call to you...

You reached out a smoke-like hand, and to your surprise you were actually able to touch the chain. Not sure what madness was compelling you, you pulled the necklace up over the gypsy's head - much to her surprise - and slipped it over your own.

Instantly, you felt a rush of sensation through your body, and your mind filled with the amulet's hidden knowledge. Through some strange magic, you knew you had just gained the ability to make yourself visible to the living eye at will, and further - you could transform your appearance to look like anyone or anything you desired.

You swept from the room, leaving the somewhat panicked mystic behind you, and phased through a wall that seemed to lead into the adjacent store's bathroom. There, you rested for a moment, taking in the sudden power you had just acquired.

You looked up at the mirror above the sink, and were quite surprised to find that you could see yourself, through your reflection seemed slightly transparent. "Maybe I can see myself, but others can't see me unless I choose to let them?"

Focusing, you decided to try and transform into the first person that came to your mind...
